ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Broadened Chinese vocabulary and grammar, improved reading speed and pronunciation
I developed my Chinese grammar, vocabulary, and cultural knowledge through this course.
I improved my reading and writing skills quite a bit and learned some more complex grammar structure.
Improvement of my Chinese pronunciation, grammar, and vocabulary.
Learned Chinese grammatical structures and widened Chinese vocabulary
Through this class, I learned more vocabulary and grammar.
I learned much more about chinese customs and specific terminology and grammar structures
I learned conversational and formal Chinese.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I never have anything bad to say about Chinese classes at Yale, I think the program is very strong and the instructors are always proactively looking for ways to make it even better.

Though the pacing is sometimes faster than it was in 132 (two lessons in one week), it doesn't feel harder; rather, this semester felt more managable than 132 because I knew what to expect and how to study.

Strengths: consistent learning, gratifying outcomes 
Weaknesses: little to no cultural content on China

The only thing I would change about the course would be to focus a bit more on casual speaking and conversation. The textbook included grammar that I don't think I would ever use when speaking to others in Chinese.

One strength of this course is our daily interactions. I enjoyed how the class was very engaging and everyone wanted to learn. A weakness of this course is the textbook. I understand that the grammar in this textbook is needed, but the content is not applicable to daily life.

strength is that ao lao shi is very passionate and enthusiastic about teaching

that said, she grades pretty strictly and the participation feels forced at times
I appreciate Professor Ao's consistent level of enthusiasm for the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! You will learn a lot and develop a deeper connection to your Chinese peers as well as grow more confident in your Chinese
Yes! The structure of the class sets students up for improvement, no matter what level of Chinese you are at.
Yes! It definitely helps to engage with Chinese every day. The homework facilitated my learning, and the pace of grammar lessons in the classroom is challenging but productive.
Yes, if you already have a relatively strong background in Chinese.
I would recommend this course to other students. It helped to consolidate what Chinese I already knew and added more vocab. It definitely helped with listening and speaking skills.
i would recommend CHNS 142 for those seeking to boost their understanding of chinese
Yes, I would.
